data.title: Visiting Specialty Providers
data.text:
Macy Schott, AuD

Complete Hearing

Macy Schott recently completed her Doctor of Audiology degree from UNL. A doctor of audiology is licensed to treat hearing issues, dispense and fit hearing devices, and assist patients in improving their hearing health. Dr. Schott has been a part of the Complete Hearing Team since 2015. She was drawn to Audiology because she knows the value of communication on our everyday relationships. She wanted to be able to help patients communicate successfully and enjoy their family and loved ones.

Blake Studley, AuD

Audiology & Hearing Center

Blake Studley completed his Master of Science in Audiology at Central Missouri State University in 2003. He went on to completed his Doctorate degree in Audiology at the University of Florida in 2007.

Studley is board certified through the American Academy of Audiology. He is a Fellow of the American Academy of Audiology, a member of the Academy of Doctors of Audiology, and a member of the Nebraska Speech-Language-Hearing Association.

Kaliprasad Ayala, MD

Pioneer Heart Institute

Dr. Ayala received his Doctorate of Medicine degree from the K.M. School of Post-Graduate Medicine & Research in Ahmedabad, India. He served his internship and completed a residency and a chief residency in Internal Medicine, as well as a fellowship in Cardiology at Hahnemann University Hospital in Philadelphia, Pennsylvania. Dr. Ayala is certified by the American Board of Internal Medicine American Board of Internal Medicine and the American Board of Internal Medicine Subspecialty Board of Cardiovascular Disease.

Anand Deshmukh, MD

Nebraska Heart Institute

Dr. Deshmukh received his Doctorate of Medicine degree from Grant Medical College in Mumbai, India. He completed his residency at Creighton University (Omaha) in the Department of Internal Medicine. Fellowships were completed at both Creighton University and Prairie Advanced Heart/Vascular in Springfield, IL. Dr. Deshmukh is certified by the American Board of Internal Medicine in both Cardiovascular Disease and Interventional Cardiology.

Steven Krueger, MD

Nebraska Heart Institute

Dr. Steven Krueger is a cardiologist in Lincoln, Nebraska, and is affiliated with the Nebraska Heart Institute. He graduated from the University of Nebraska Medical Center, and completed his internship and residency at Stanford University Medical Center. Dr. Krueger served fellowships in cardiology, electrophysiology, and congestive heart failure at the University of Utah. He is board certified in cardiology.

Clyde Meckel, MD

Bryan Heart

Dr. Meckel received his Medical Doctorate degree from the University of Nebraska College of Medicine in Omaha, Nebraska. He completed his internship and residency in internal medicine, and a fellowship in cardiology at Brigham and Women’s School in Boston, Massachusetts. Dr. Meckel is board certified by the American Board of Internal Medicine and the American Board Internal Medicine Subspecialty of Cardiovascular Disease and Interventional Cardiology.

Douglas Netz, MD

Pioneer Heart Institute

Dr. Netz received his medical degree from the Universtiy of Nebraska Medical Center in Omaha, Nebraska. He also completed his Internal Medicine Residency and Cardiology Fellowship at the University of Nebraska Medicine. Netz is certified by the American Board of Internal Medicine in its subspecialty board of Cardiovascular Disease and Interventional Cardiology. Dr. Netz provides comprehensive cardiology services including preventative, diagnostic, medical and interventional therapies.

John Steuter, MD

Bryan Heart

John Steuter, MD, is a cardiologist at Bryan Heart. Steuter is a graduate of the University of Nebraska Medical Center College of Medicine and joined Bryan Heart in 2015 after completing his residency and fellowship at the University of Nebraska Medical Center. He is board certified in internal medicine and cardiovascular medicine with the American Board of Internal Medicine.

Cassie Lundberg, PA-C

Pioneer Heart Institute

Cassie earned her Master’s of Physician Assistant Studies from Union College. Shortly after, she began her career in Cardiovascular medicine here at Pioneer Heart. She previously worked as an Emergency Medical Technician in Fargo, North Dakota and has degrees in both Biochemistry and Athletic Training. Lundberg has a strong interest in preventative medicine and helping patients with lifestyle modifications that may prevent or treat numerous Cardiovascular diseases. Some of these include hypertension, coronary artery disease, heart failure, peripheral vascular disease, and arrhythmias.

Hemantha Koduri, MD

Pioneer Heart Institute

Dr. Hemantha Koduri specializes in internal medicine, vascular medicine and interventional cardiovascular medicine. After completing internal medicine residency at University of Illinois-Saint Joseph Hospital, Chicago, he worked as an assistant professor of medicine and teaching hospitalist in department of internal medicine at Mount Sinai Hospital – Chicago Medical School. He completed fellowship training in vascular medicine gaining expertise in treating diseases of arteries, veins and lymphatic vessels at Cleveland Clinic, Cleveland, OH. He then moved to Nebraska for fellowship training in general cardiovascular medicine at Creighton University, Omaha, NE. Following his general cardiology training he joined Penn State University Hershey Medical Center where he graduated in interventional vascular, cardiology and structural heart diseases. He is board certified in internal medicine, vascular medicine, vascular imaging, echocardiography, nuclear cardiology, general cardiovascular medicine and interventional cardiovascular medicine.

Dr. Koduri has expertise in treating patients with thrombosis, thrombophilias, hypertension, lipid disorders, heart rhythm abnormalities, heart attacks, heart valve and structural disorders, heart failure, blockages in blood vessels of the neck, arms, legs, abdomen including aorta, kidney arteries and varicose veins. He performs high risk coronary and peripheral arterial interventions including chronic total occlusions(CTO) for revascularization, transcatheter aortic valve replacement, patent formen ovale closure, venous ablation and stenting.

Geoffrey Basler, MD

Complete Family Dermatology

Basler earned his medical degree from the University of Michigan in 1996. He completed a year-long transitional year internship in Dermatopathology at Emory University in 1997, followed by a three-year residency in dermatology, dermatopathology, and Mohs micrographic and reconstructive surgery at Oregon Health & Science University. Dr. Basler underwent advanced training in melanoma and cutaneous oncology at the University of California-San Francisco and Stanford University from July to November 1999.

He achieved certification by the American Board of Dermatology in 2000 and was re-certified in 2009. He is a member of the American Academy of Dermatology, International Society of Cosmetic and Laser Surgery, and American Society of Mohs Surgery.

Brent Behrens, PA-C

Complete Family Dermatology

PA Behrens earned his Bachelor of Arts in Psychology from the University of Nebraska-Lincoln before completing a degree in Physician Assistant Studies from Union College in Lincoln, NE. He is a member of the American Association of Physicians Assistants and Society of Dermatology Physician Assistants; and has worked with Dr. Basler since 2002.

Matthew Glathar, MD

Lincoln Nephrology and Hypertension, PC

Dr. Glathar received his medical degree from the University of Iowa College of Medicine in Iowa City, Iowa. He completed his residency in internal medicine at the University of Chicago Hospital, in Chicago, Illinois, and an internal medicine, nephrology fellowship at the University of Alabama Birmingham Hospital in Birmingham, Alabama. Dr. Glathar is certified by the American Board of Internal Medicine in Nephrology and Internal Medicine.

Leslie Allen Spry, MD

Lincoln Nephrology and Hypertension, PC

Dr. Spry received his medical degree from the University of Nebraska College of Medicine in Omaha, Nebraska. He completed his internship and an Internal Medicine residency at University of Nebraska Affiliated Hospitals in Omaha, Nebraska, and fellowships at the Washington University Department of Internal Medicine, Division of Internal Medicine, Division of Nephrology, Barnes Hospital and Jewish Hospital in St. Louis, Missouri. He is certified by the American Board of Internal Medicine in Nephrology and Internal Medicine. Dr. Spry serves as the Medical Director of the York General Dialysis Services.

James Bobenhouse, MD

Neurology Associates, P.C.

Dr. Bobenhouse completed his undergraduate work at the University of Nebraska, Lincoln, and received his medical degree from the University of Nebraska College of Medicine in Omaha. He completed his Internal Medicine and Neurology residency at Creighton University.

Dr. Bobenhouse is Board Certified by the American Board of Psychiatry and Neurology and carries a Subspecialty Certification in Vascular Neurology. His professional memberships include the Nebraska Medical Association and the American Academy of Neurology and the Nebraska Academy of Neurologists and Neurosurgeons.

Matthew Kniss, MD

Neurology Associates, P.C.

Dr. Kniss completed his undergraduate work at Nebraska Wesleyan University, Lincoln, NE, and received his medical degree from the University of Nebraska College of Medicine in Omaha. He completed his Internal Medicine residency at St Joseph’s Hospital and Medical Center in Phoenix, AZ.

Dr. Kniss is Board Certified by the American Board of Psychiatry and Neurology. His professional memberships include the Nebraska Medical Association and the American Academy of Neurology, American Epilepsy Society, and the Nebraska Medical Association.

Benjamin Bixenmann, MD

Nebraska Neurosurgery Group

Dr. Bixenmann specializes in surgery of the spine, brain, and peripheral nerves at the Nebraska Neurosurgery Group, LLC.

Dr. Bixenmann grew up in Lincoln, Nebraska, and graduated from Pius X High School in 2001. He earned his Bachelors of Science degree from Hillsdale College in 2005 graduating Magna Cum Laude.

Dr. Bixenmann received his Doctorate of Medicine, with High Distinction, in 2009 at the University of Nebraska College of Medicine in Omaha, NE. He completed a neurological surgery residency at the Mayfield Clinic and University of Cincinnati Medical Center in 2015.

Steven Gogela, MD

Neurological and Spinal Surgery, LLC

Dr. Steve Gogela travels to York from Neurological and Spinal Surgery in Lincoln. He specializes in surgery of the brain, spine and peripheral nerves. Dr. Gogela graduated Summa Cum Laude with a Bachelor of Arts in Biology from Saint Louis University in St. Louis, MO. He went on to receive his Doctor of Medicine with High Distinction from the University of Nebraska College of Medicine (UNMC) in Omaha, NE.

Gogela received his residency training with the Department of Neurosurgery at the University of Cincinnati in Ohio. Throughout his education, Dr. Gogela has held various offices, received numerous academic honors and scholarships and contributed to a number of medical journals and publications. He is board eligible in neurological surgery and is a member of the Congress of Neurological Surgeons (CNS), American Association of Neurological Surgeons (AANS) and Ohio State Neurosurgical Society (OHSNS).

Adam Depue, PA-C

Neurological and Spinal Surgery, LLC

Adam Depue received a Bachelor of Science degree in Biology and Biochemistry with a Minor in Math and Chemistry from the University of Nebraska-Lincoln in December 2006. In 2012, he earned his Master of Physician Assistant Studies from Union College in Lincoln graduating Cum Laude with Capstone honors. He is certified in Advanced Cardiac Life Support (ACLS) and Basic Disaster Life Support (BDLS). Adam is a member of the American Academy of Physician Assistants.

Mehmet Sitki Copur, MD FACP

Morrison Cancer Center, Mary Lanning Hospital

Dr. Copur graduated from medical school at Hacettepe University in Ankara, Turkey. He served an Internal Medicine Residency, also in Turkey, before completing an internship and residency, both at Chicago Medical School in Chicago. His medical oncology fellowship was at the National Cancer Institute in Bethesda, Maryland. Dr. Copur is an adjunct faculty professor at the University of Nebraska Medical Center Department of Internal Medicine Division of Hematology/Oncology.

He is board certified in Internal Medicine and Medical Oncology, and serves on numerous committees. In 2017, Dr. Copur became a member of an expert panel charged with updating the Metastatic Pancreatic Cancer guidelines for the American Society of Clinical Oncology. Copur is a fellow in the American College of Physicians, and has been heavily involved in research and clinical trials.

Steven G. Dunder, MD

Cancer Partners of Nebraska

Dr. Dunder attended the University of Nebraska, Lincoln for his undergraduate degree and received his Doctor of Medicine at the University of Nebraska Medical Center in Omaha. He did his residency in Internal Medicine at the University of Texas Health Science Center and his fellowship in Hematology/Oncology at the Medical Center of South Carolina. He is board certified in Internal Medicine, Hematology and Oncology.

Nathan Green, DO

Cancer Partners of Nebraska

Dr. Green received his medical degree from the University of Osteopathic Medicine & Health Sciences in Des Moines, Iowa. He completed a residency in Internal Medicine at the University of Texas and completed a Medical Oncology fellowship at Baylor University Medical Center in Houston, Texas. Dr. Green is certified in Internal Medicine and Medical Oncology by the American Board of Internal Medicine.

Scott Bigelow, MD

Nebraska Orthopaedic Center

Dr. Bigelow received his medical degree from the University of Nebraska College of Medicine in Omaha, Nebraska. He completed his residency in orthopaedic surgery at the University of Oklahoma, Department of Orthopaedic Surgery and Rehabilitation. Dr. Bigelow is Board Certified in Orthopaedic Surgery.

Douglas Koch, MD

Nebraska Orthopaedic Center

Dr. Douglas A. Koch joined Lincoln Orthopaedic Center, P.C. in August 2005. He is a graduate of the University of Nebraska Medical Center and completed his residency in Orthopaedic Surgery at the University of Tennessee. Dr. Koch is board certified in Orthopaedic Surgery and completed a Sports Medicine Fellowship in Phoenix, Arizona, at the Institute for Bone and Joint Disorders and SCG Orthopaedic Clinic.

Chad Springer, PA-C

Nebraska Orthopaedic Center

Physician Assistant Springer received his Master’s Degree in Physician Assistant Studies from the University of Nebraska College of Medicine in Omaha, Nebraska. Physician Assistant Springer is certified by the National Commission of Physician Assistants.

Sam Dostal, PA-C

Nebraska Orthopaedic Center

Sam Dostal joined Lincoln Orthopaedic Center, P.C. in August 2005 and practices in the clinical and surgical settings. He is a native of Scribner, Nebraska. Sam is a 2005 graduate of Philadelphia University in Philadelphia, Pennsylvania, where he received his Master’s Degree in the Physician Assistant Program. Sam is board certified by the National Commission on Certification of Physician Assistants.

Liane Donovan, MD

MD Pain

Dr. Donovan received her medical degree from the University of Kansas School of Medicine in Kansas City, Kansas. She completed her internal medicine internship at the University of Missouri in Kansas City, Missouri, and her residency in anesthesiology at the University of Kansas School of Medicine in Kansas City, Kansas. Dr. Donovan is board certified in pain medicine by the American Board of Pain Medicine and board certified in anesthesiology by the American Board of Anesthesiology. She has over 20 years of experience in treating pain patients in Nebraska, and excels in treating a wide variety of pain conditions in the spine and other areas. Dr. Donovan helps patients get back to the life they were once living by performing treatments such as epidural steroid injections, radio-frequency neuroablation for spondylosis or migraine treatment, vertebral insufficiency fractures with kyphoplasty, and Botox injections.

As part of the treatment process, Dr. Donovan includes multiple modalities of treatment including physical therapy, chiropractic care, medication management strategies, and behavioral therapies, to treat a variety of chronic pain issues.

Douglas Spurgeon, MD

Nebraska Pain Institute

Douglas Spurgeon, MD is a Board-Certified Anesthesiologist and Pain Management Specialist at the Nebraska Pain Institute. He attended Nebraska Wesleyan University and earned a Bachelor of Arts in Biology. He then attended UNMC where he received his Doctorate of

Medicine.

Dr. Spurgeon has an extensive training background including three years of General Surgery residency followed by another three years of Anesthesiology residence. Dr. Spurgeon brings a unique perspective to treating chronic painful conditions.

Zach Lerner, APRN

MD Pain

Zack graduated from the nurse practitioner program at the University of Kansas school of nursing in 2011 with an MSN in family practice. He then spent 4 years at KC bone and joint in Kansas City where he was an orthopedic nurse practitioner specializing in total joint replacements. Since leaving KC bone and joint in 2015 he has become well versed in pain management and has specialized in pain management for the last 5 years. Currently Zack Is in the finishing stages of completing his Doctorate in Nursing Practice and his final project is focusing on the correlation between chronic pain and depression.

Gustavo Machado, MD

Prairie Orthopaedic & Plastic Surgery, PC

Dr. Gustavo Machado is a Plastic, Reconstructive, Hand and Upper Extremity Surgeon. He joins the practice from California where he completed an Integrated Residency in Plastic and Reconstructive Surgery at Loma Linda University, and a Hand and Upper Extremity Surgery Fellowship at the University of California Irvine Medical Center. Throughout his years of training he was involved with research and academia and has published several scientific articles and given presentations at national and regional meetings. Dr. Machado is a native of Brazil and received his medical school training in Argentina. He is fluent in Portuguese and Spanish.

Jill Gamble, PA-C

Prairie Orthopaedic & Plastic Surgery, PC

Jill is a Nationally Certified Physician Assistant at Prairie Orthopaedic & Plastic Surgery, PC and has been with the Prairie team since 2021. She is a Lincoln native and graduated with her Masters of Physician Assistant Studies from Union College in 2015. Jill then spent 5 years in Georgia with her husband and son working in Orthopaedics and Rheumatology and is thrilled to be near extended family in Nebraska again. She is a member of the Nebraska Academy of Physician Assistants as well as the American Academy of Physician Assistants.

Shaun Ring, PA-C, NCCPA

Prairie Orthopaedic & Plastic Surgery, PC

Shaun is a Nationally Certified Physician Assistant (NCCPA) at Prairie Orthopaedic & Plastic Surgery, PC and has been with the Prairie team since 2019. Shaun was born in Council Bluffs, IA and moved to Lincoln, NE when he was 8 years old. He has been in the US Army for 22 years, and currently serves in the US Army Reserves in Omaha. He graduated from the University of the Pacific in Sacramento, CA with a Master’s of Physician Assistant Studies. Shaun is married and has 3 children. Shaun is a member of the American Academy of Physician Assistants and the California Academy of Physician Assistants.

Robert VandeGuchte, MD

Nebraska Orthopaedic Center

Dr. VandeGuchte received his medical degree from the University of Alberta, Edmonton, Canada. He completed his Orthopaedic Residency at the University of Alberta and a fellowship in Sports Medicine at the University of Calgary Sports Medicine Center. He also completed a second fellowship in Spine Surgery at the University of British Columbia Spine Trauma and Disease Center. Dr. VandeGuchte serves as Team Orthopaedic Surgeon for the Lincoln Stars Hockey team and the Lincoln Saltdogs Baseball team.

Michael Kowalke, PA-C

Nebraska Orthopaedic Center

Michael Kowalke, PA-C is a Lincoln, NE native, and graduated in 2003 from the University of Nebraska-Lincoln with a degree in Biological Sciences. He then moved to Las Vegas, NV to work as a forensic Pathologist Assistant. In 2007, Michael received his Doctorate of Chiropractic from Southern California University and concurrently acquired Certification as a Strength and Condition Specialist. He migrated back to the Midwest and practiced for 4 years as a sports medicine chiropractor in the Lincoln. Michael received his Masters of Physician Assistant Studies from Union College in Lincoln, NE.

Michael is a member of the American Academy of Physician Assistants, the Nebraska Academy of Physician Assistants, the American Chiropractic Association, and the National Strength and Conditioning Association. He is board certified as a Physician Assistant by the National Commission on Certification of Physician Assistants.

Sarah Ongstad, MD

Bryan Heart

Dr. Ongstad is board certified in Vascular and General Surgery by the American Board of Surgery; Ongstad joined Bryan Heart in 2019. Ongstad earned her Medical degree from the University of Wisconsin School of Medicine and Public Health, Madison, WI.

She completed her residency in general surgery at Iowa Methodist Medical Center in Des Moines, IA, and completed a fellowship in vascular and endovascular surgery at Eastern Virginia Medical School in Norfolk, VA.

Robert Pitsch, MD

Bryan Heart

Dr. Robert Pitsch received his medical degree in 1987 at the University of Nebraska Medical Center (Omaha). He completed his internship at Hennepin County Medical Center (Minnesota), and surgical residency at the University of Utah School of Medicine. Dr. Pitsch completed his fellowship at Case Western Research University in Ohio. Pitsch is Board Certified by the American Board of Surgery with subspecialty Certificates in both Surgery and Vascular Surgery. Dr. Pitsch is originally from Seward, Nebraska.

Allie Sohn, MD

Nebraska Heart

Dr. Allie Sohn is a Board-Certified vascular surgeon. She received her medical degree from the Albert Einstein College of Medicine and completed her surgical residency in General Surgery at the Montefiore Medical Center and Albert Einstein College of Medicine, Bronx, NY. Dr. Sohn completed her fellowship at the University of South Floria College of Medicine, Tampa, Florida in Vascular Surgery.
